content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, StudioPress launches a new blog, Know The Code gives you a roadmap to go from zero to Genesis hero, and your chance to chat live with Brian Gardner.

Themes

SEO Themes officially launches their Fitness Pro theme…

Hey everyone! We just officially launched a new theme, Fitness Pro – https://t.co/BWpZjJHwFK Check it out! #GenesisWP #WordPress #SeoThemes

— Seo Themes (@seothemeswp) February 9, 2017

…and they’re looking for suggestions for their next creation.

Taking requests for our next Genesis theme. Any suggestions? P.S if we use your idea, you'll get a free download 😉 #GenesisWP #WordPress

— Seo Themes (@seothemeswp) February 11, 2017

JT Grauke, creator of popular Genesis theme Showcase Pro and more, shares a preview of his next theme.

Started fleshing out some ideas for a new #genesiswp theme https://t.co/MXk13TE2lv @dribbble @studiopress #ui #ux #webdesign #wordpress

— JT Grauke (@jtgrauke) February 11, 2017

ZigZagPress push out updates to a couple of their themes, Plugged and Chic.

ICYMI: we rolled out updates to both Plugged and Chic #genesiswp themes last week.

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) February 8, 2017

Showcase

First up this week, Mark over at acmehatco.com wrote in about his new site on Genesis:

I finally launched my new brand and startup “Acme Hat Co” with the website being based on Genesis. After reading about the framework about a year ago it seemed like the perfect backbone for a quick and secure site. …I would love to get some feedback from you guys on perhaps anything we could improve on!

Stunning site on Genesis… https://t.co/WfyPhFGvP8

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) February 9, 2017

Shortly after launching StudioPress Sites, have StudioPress have re-launched their blog over at studiopress.blog too (I assume it will eventually replace the current studiopress.com/blog version).

Hello World: Introducing the (new) StudioPress Blog https://t.co/nj1Vu14d5Y

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) February 9, 2017

Great sites from the always top notch Pilcrow Pixel. First, for bollywoodvibes.co.uk…

We’ve just launched a new website for leading professional dance company @BollywoodVibes: https://t.co/FWnWokXjsE #genesiswp #WordPress

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) February 8, 2017

…and then for vonemcreative.com

Just launched a new site for writing & public relations consultancy Vonem Creative Media: https://t.co/2qU2uiovUY #genesiswp #WordPress

— Pilcrow + Pixel (@PilcrowPixel) February 6, 2017

Patricia Alix Villa for lovepup.ca

Please congratulate Lovepup on the launch of their brand new website and brand identity design! #genesiswphttps://t.co/AudJ5J7ayI pic.twitter.com/h8mXtiuv4c

— Patricia Alix Villa (@PatFancyGirl) February 8, 2017

Resa Barillas with a redesign of greenglobaltravel.com

Green Global Travel

Best of the rest

Tonya Mork over at Know The Code has put together a roadmap of all her Genesis content (and there’s a lot of free stuff in there too) so it’s never been easier to work through it.

Want a #GenesisWP Roadmap to grow your skills here on Know the Code? Check it out. Use it as your guide. https://t.co/uVICHhNcpw

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) February 10, 2017

Sridhar Katakam on how to move post info above the title in the Genesis Featured Posts widget.

How to move post info above title in Genesis Featured Posts widgets:https://t.co/IqEpngD0or#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/7yGZwlMekn

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) February 6, 2017

Heartfelt article from Tara Claeys on How to Wake Up From A Professional Nightmare.

How to Wake Up From A Professional Nightmare https://t.co/vwHFgNYR4g @erin3flynn @BournCreative @maurafredericks pic.twitter.com/D5IbDMBQO1

— Tara Claeys (@design_tlc) February 6, 2017

And finally…

If you’ve got a question for StudioPress founder Brian Gardner he’ll be going live on Facebook this Thursday 16 February at 1pm CST.

Join me next Thursday at 1:00 CST for StudioPress Facebook Live. Submit your questions now. —> https://t.co/yHE1VXQXCs #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/BpyQABjMRw

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) February 9, 2017

—

That’s all for this week.

Did I miss your awesome thing? Go add it via the homepage and I’ll include my favourite submissions next time around.

Till next week, let’s keep Genesis awesome.

excerpt.rendered: StudioPress launches a new blog, Know The Code gives you a roadmap to go from zero to Genesis hero, and your chance to chat live with Brian Gardner.
